item.title: Elixir, Useful resources
item.description: Lately, I discovered Elixir, and I think the functional programming can scary someone, but once you get in, is a good way to learn a different approach to programming, and Elixir is a modern language based on Erlang VM. I want to share some resources that I found useful for become more comfortable with the language. Resources Official Documentation and guide: https://hexdocs.pm/elixir/introduction.html. Elixir School: https://elixirschool.com/en I think that this website cover the principal aspect of the language, is simple and minimal for learning fast.

item.title: Elixir install with asdf (Linux)
item.description: Lately, I’ve discovered Elixir, a functional programming language. Its syntax is very clean, and it’s quite enjoyable to explore a new paradigm. I believe that every programmer should establish a workflow for familiarizing themselves with a new language and i recommend to install Elixir throw asdf, a tool version manager. Note that this is not official documentation; it’s a simple walkthrough and check the documentation if you have time.
